review_title: Great place to work, but I'm scared for my retirement.
pros: Nice people and facilities. Flexible working hours. The university is striving to be a leader.
cons: The pension plan is terrible. Every time we have salary negotiations there is a strike vote. The faculty are overworked and the employer doesn't recognize that our workload is much higher than peer universities.

pros: Enjoyed it quite a bit

pros: Diverse, fun environment, great culture

pros:
First and foremost the staff.  My specific team is wonderful to work with and everyone I have had the pleasure to meet in all faculties have been very welcoming and easy to work with.
There are a lot of activities and committees to become involved with to develop knowledge and learn different approaches to challenges.
The students are engaged in their learning and career paths and employers have nothing but wonderful, positive reports.  The employers enjoy our students because they 'work hard and are eager to learn' while on internships or co-ops.  
I really enjoy how the students are intertwined with my work day through student hires and their volunteer work.  It is refreshing to come to work everyday and be infused with their energy.

Work life balance is encouraged in our department and we foster a good 'team' environment supporting each other in their very different roles within Student Life.
I am on a contract and was offered excellent compensation and welcomed to be a part of the team from day one.  There is no division between contract and salaried full time employees.
cons: Having worked in the private sector my whole life I find some decisions take longer and that influences my productivity

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Oshawa, ON
pros: University is brand new and still growing, hence the community is small and close tied. Because of that your advisor always stays in touch, which is great and extremely helpful! Research groups are small, and that fosters good collaboration. There is an opportunity to get involved and shape the future of the school, which is way easier to do here as compared to old well-established institutions.
cons:
Working in a small community also has its own drawbacks. There is a terrible culture of gossiping, everyone has to know everything about others and forward it to other colleagues. It's not a big hurdle, as long as you accept the fact that people would be discussing you behind your back.
Also there is a constant problem with lack of budget, thus for some groups travelling to conferences happening outside of North America is a tabu.

review_title: Room to grow is corrupted by politics
job_title: Teaching and Research Assistant in Oshawa, ON
pros:
- A lot of research opportunities
- New equipment access is available, IF you can network and stay on everyone's good side
- Innovation all around
- Everyone understands what they got involved into and that makes it easier to cope with ridiculousness
cons:
- Innovation on a shoestring budget
- Ridiculous amounts of politics and power play
- Situations such as :"Documation was scribbled by an ancient grad on a clay tablet, in another university", "I don't know how, but it works!", "Thar be orcs in the uni's underground workshop! BEWARE!", and last but not least "I don't think Radiation HAZMAT suit is enough for you to get near that fire alarm. Here's a lead spoon for you to play and nibble on, though."

review_title: Teething pains, but on the right track
pros: High degree of interaction with the students and professors, helps improve verbal and presentation skills. Increased knowledge of the subject you'll be teaching, even if you are familiar with it; questions from the students always help both of you. With a good professor to work under, this position can be relaxing and fun.
cons: Can become overwhelmed with work depending on who you are working under. Larger classes accross multiple TAs lead to inflexible marking. Payroll issues. Complaints are difficult to get addressed in some cases. I personally had a good experience, but I know many others had extreme workload issues.

review_title: UOIT is an exciting place to work. Its a new university so there is constant change and tweaking of positions.
job_title: Senior Development Officer in Oshawa, ON
pros: New university, fast paced, challenging, exciting, lots of opportunity, lots of growth
cons: new university, under staffed, wages not really where thay should be for a post secondary institution,

pros: The hours are flexible, and lenient. Everyone is willing to help you, and understanding you are a student and are learning on the job.
cons: I do not think there is a downside, in my opinion as a student. However, I am unsure of the disadvantages of being a full time employee as opposed to a student

pros: Extremely friendly environment in the registrar's department. Everything is easy to follow and understand. Position was well trained throughout a training period. The travel costs are covered by the institution and rental cars are provided to you.
cons: This position is extremely fast pace. You are required to travel about 98% of the job. It is fast paced, you must be able to talk to many types of strangers confidently. You will be doing many presentations infront of large groups. Sometimes the job can become tiresome in terms of the amount of travelling.

pros:
+profs are very knowledgeable, and working for them is great

cons:

review_title: The working environment and facility is great of UOIT.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Oshawa, ON
pros:
1. Infrastructure is good.
2. Have lots of facility for international students.
3. Have a huge collection of journals in the library.
4. Classrooms are well oriented and decorated.
5. The medical facility, gym everything is well organized.
cons:
1. Needs to have a proper residential system at a low price for international student.
2. Needs to build more laboratories.
3. Needs to have some recreation system for students.
4. Needs to lower the tuition fee for an international student.
5. Needs to improve the transportation system.

pros: Make your own schedule, feel great about research, teaching, and interacting with people directly in your field. The professors are amazing, always ready to help. Free IT.
cons: They pay is pretty awful. Definitely dont make enough to live day to day, and when research isn't going well it can be quite stressful

review_title: Graduate Student FESNS TA Laboratory Instructor

cons: New and small University. For graduate students it may be hard to find funding for living expenses and research.
